esas 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Combine the 5 tables from the ESAS Data Model to a single data.frame as preparation for uploading

Source: R/Transform_ESAS_Tables_4_Upload.R
Transform_ESAS_Tables_4_Upload.Rd

The resulting data.frame has 18 columns, where the first column is "RecordType" which indicates the type of record (FI, EC, ES, EP, EO). The remaining columns are filled with the respective data from the input tables.

Usage

Transform_ESAS_Tables_4_Upload(
  campaigns_tbl,
  samples_tbl,
  positions_tbl,
  observations_tbl,
  data_provider,
  country
)

Arguments

campaigns_tbl

(data.frame) of campaigns table as returned by Read_ESAS_Tables()$CAMPAIGNS

samples_tbl

(data.frame) of samples table as returned by Read_ESAS_Tables()$SAMPLES

positions_tbl

(data.frame) of positions table as returned by Read_ESAS_Tables()$POSITIONS

observations_tbl

(data.frame) of observations table as returned by Read_ESAS_Tables()$OBSERVATIONS

data_provider

(integer) code of the data provider as described by the ESAS Data Model file information table.

country

(character) ISO_3166 country code of the data provider. For example: "BE".

Value

(data.frame) with 18 columns and a number of rows equal to the sum of rows of the input tables plus one (for the file information row).

See also

Other upload functions: Export_ESAS_Upload_Matrix()

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
ESAS_TABLES_LIST <-
  Read_ESAS_Tables(
    path = "local_folder_with_downloaded_files",
    file_encoding = "UTF-8"
  )

Transform_ESAS_Tables_4_Upload(
  campaigns_tbl = ESAS_TABLES_LIST$CAMPAIGNS,
  samples_tbl = ESAS_TABLES_LIST$SAMPLES,
  positions_tbl = ESAS_TABLES_LIST$POSITIONS,
  observations_tbl = ESAS_TABLES_LIST$OBSERVATIONS,
  data_provider = "202",
  country = "BE"
)
} # }
